HIREBUS-227 / Hirebus Testcases / Home

Verify the pagination works properly

Pagination logic
Number of pages = ceil(Total records / records per page)
Records on last page = total records - {(total number of pages - 1) * records per page}

Test case covering positive and negative scenarios.

Normal

Priority

Not set

Behavior

Not set

Type

Smoke

Layer

Not set

Is Flaky

No

Milestone

-

Automation

Manual

Status

Actual

Is Muted

No

Action

Input data
Expected result

Total pages should be 4.
Step 2
Action

Go to last page (e.g. on 4th page)
Input data
Expected result

It should contain (0 < records <= 10) on the last page (e.g. we would have 7)

Input data
Expected result

It should show 10, 25, 50 and 100 as options
Step 4

Select 25 entries from options
Input data
Expected result

Action

Check the number of records select-box
Input data
Expected result

It should show 25 as selected option
Step 6
Action

Check number of pages
Input data
Expected result

It should not be approximately half of page than 10 entries per page (e.g. in our case 2)
Step 7
Action

Go to last page
Input data
Expected result

It should contain (0 < records <= 25) on the last page (e.g. we would have 12)
Step 8
Action

Select records per page 50
Input data
Expected result

It should show all the records on single page if have less than 50 records like our example.
Step 9
Action

Check for Number of pages
Input data
Expected result

It should be Page 1 of 1
Step 10
Action

Enter alphabetic value in records per page input box and press Enter
Input data
Expected result

It should revert back to previously selected recorder per page value.
Step 11
Action

Click on the input box of "Go to page:"
Input data
Expected result

Input field should come into focus
Step 12
Action

Enter the alphabetic character as input
Input data
Expected result

Nothing should change in the input
Step 13
Action

Enter the page number greater than total page (e.g. if total pages are 4 then enter 5)
Input data
Expected result

It should automatically select last page number (e.g. upon entering 5 in will select and show 4)
Step 14
Action

Go back to 1st page and click on the Next button
Input data
Expected result

Input data

HIREBUS-133 / Hirebus Testcases / Home / Header

Verify the user can generate the Testing Link with the “Get Testing Link” button

Severity

Normal

Priority

Not set

Behavior

Not set

Type

Smoke

Layer

Not set

Is Flaky

No

Milestone

-

Automation

Manual

Status

Actual

Is Muted

No
Pre-conditions
  1. The user must be logged in as either a Super Admin or a Company User.
  2. The Dashboard page should be displayed as the default landing page after login.
Post-conditions

Submit the form and check the candidate should appear on the home page/dashboard as well as on necessary places

Parameters

User type: Super admin, Company

Steps to reproduce

Step 1
Action

Locate and click on the “Get Testing Link” button in the header section
Input data
Expected result

The “Get Testing Link” button should be displayed on header (righ side) and clicking on it should open “Get Testing Link” modal immediately without any errors.
Step 2
Action

Verify that the “Get Testing Link” modal is displayed
Input data
Expected result

The modal should open and contain the following fields and controls:
• Role (optional) dropdown.
• Language dropdown.
• Text box displaying the generated testing link
• Copy Link button.
Step 3
Action

Verify the Testing link from Text box
Input data
Expected result

The link should contain the company name (ex: https://staging.hirebus.com/survey/register?co=company-name) and navigating to that link should open the survey form
Step 4
Action

Click the “Copy Link” button and verify
Input data
Expected result

It should copy the link to the clipboard. The copied link should be the same showing on the Text box and open the same survey.
Step 5
Action

Select a role from the “Role (optional)” dropdown and verify the link
Input data
Expected result

The selected role should be reflected in the dropdown, and the testing link should have the parameter position parameter (ex: https://staging.hirebus.com/survey/register?co=company-name&**position=Customer%20Service**) in the Text field, as well as Copy Link should copy that link
Step 6
Action

Select a language from the “Language dropdown and verify the link
Input data
Expected result

Now the selected language should also be reflected in the dropdown, and the testing link should have the parameter position parameter (ex: https://staging.hirebus.com/survey/register?co=company-name&position=Customer%20Service&**lang=en**) in the Text field, as well as Copy Link should copy that link
Step 7
Action

Clear the role dropdown value and verify link
Input data
Expected result

The testing link should no longer include the `position` parameter in the text field, and the “Copy Link” button should copy the link without the `position` parameter
Step 8
Action

Clear the language dropdown value and verify link
Input data
Expected result

Now testing link should no longer contain the `lang` parameter in text field, and Copy Link should also copy the link which don\'t have `lang`

Expected result

Expected result

Expected result

Action

Input data

Expected result

Action

Input data

HIREBUS-111 / Hirebus Testcases / Candidates/Employees / Filters and Sorting

Verify that sorting works correctly for all sortable columns (Name, Score, Company, Date Completed, Department, Location)

This test case verifies the sorting functionality for all available parameters in the Candidates/Employees module, ensuring that sorting in ascending and descending order works as expected.

Severity

Normal

Priority

Not set

Behavior

Not set

Type

Smoke

Layer

Not set

Is Flaky

No

Milestone

-

Automation

Manual

Status

Actual

Is Muted

No
Pre-conditions
  1. The user must be logged into the system as Superadmin.
  2. The Candidates/Employees page must have data for the following columns: Name, Score, Company, Date Completed, Department, and Location.
  3. A minimum of 5 records with varying values in each parameter must exist.

Steps to reproduce

Step 1
Action

Navigate to the Candidates/Employees module.
Input data
Expected result

The Candidates/Employees page loads successfully.
Step 2
Action

Verify the default state of the sorting (no sorting applied).
Input data
Expected result

No sorting indicators (ascending/descending) are active for any column.
Step 3
Action

Click on the Name column header.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in descending order (Z-A) with an upward arrow displayed.
Step 4
Action

Click the Name column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in ascending order (A-Z) with a downward arrow displayed.
Step 5
Action

Click on the Score column header.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in descending order (highest to lowest score).
Step 6
Action

Click the Score column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in ascending order (lowest to highest score).
Step 7
Action

Click on the Company column header.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in descending alphabetical order (Z-A) for company names.
Step 8
Action

Click the Company column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in ascending alphabetical order (A-Z) for company names.
Step 9
Action

Click on the Date Completed column header.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in descending order (newest to oldest date).
Step 10
Action

Click the Date Completed column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in ascending order (oldest to newest date).
Step 11
Action

Click on the Department column header.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in descending alphabetical order (Z-A).
Step 12
Action

Click the Department column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in ascending alphabetical order (A-Z).
Step 13
Action

Click on the Location column header.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in descending alphabetical order (Z-A).
Step 14
Action

Click the Location column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Data should be sorted in ascending alphabetical order (A-Z).
Step 15
Action

Click the Location column header again.
Input data
Expected result

Sorting should be removed from Location parameter and also default Location should be seen without any arrow in column header.
Step 16
Action

Verify that clicking any other column header resets sorting on the prior column.
Input data
Expected result

Sorting should only be active for the last clicked column.

  • Proxy: "Log In as Owner" button is available and functional.

  • Assessment: Assessment link is valid (e.g., "https://dev.hirebus.com/survey/register?co=cormieradams").

  • Started, Completed, and Incomplete Assessments: Assessment counts are correct (e.g., "Started: 0, Completed: 0, Incomplete: 0").

  • Is Test and Is Active: Correct status is shown (e.g., "Is Test: No, Is Active: Active").

  • Created: Correct creation date is displayed (e.g., "Dec 23, 2024").

  • Website URL and Website About Us URL: Functional links are provided.

  • Auth: Role (e.g., COMPANY_OWNER) is correct.

  • Archived: Status reflects if the company is archived (e.g., "Archived: No").

  • Require Phone Number: Displays correct phone number requirement (e.g., "Phone #: NOT Required").

  • Actions: Functional menu (three dots) provides options such as "Edit," "Custom Webhooks," "Locations," and "Departments."
Input data


Expected result
  • All columns are displayed with accurate data for each company.
  • Functional buttons (e.g., "Log In as Owner") and menus (e.g., Actions) work as expected.
  • Links (e.g., Assessment, Website URL) are valid and clickable.
    • Statuses and counts are accurate for each company.

Number of pages = ceil(Total records / records per page)
Records on last page = total records - {(total number of pages - 1) * records per page}

Validate that a candidate created first in GHL (as a New Lead) and appearing in HireBus, transitions to the Application Completed stage once they submit an application via the Careers page (via Typeform). Confirm that the same candidate record is utilized (via matching email), and that their details and automations update accordingly in both systems.

Severity

Normal

Priority

Not set

Behavior

Not set

Type

Smoke

Layer

Not set

Is Flaky

No

Milestone

-

Automation

Manual

Status

Actual

Is Muted

No
Pre-conditions
  • Systems and integrations (Typeform, Zapier, GHL, HireBus) are configured and functioning.
  • Candidate and Job Role exist from previous flows or are properly set up in HireBus and GHL.
  • You have a unique test email and a valid test phone number ready.
  • Careers page should be setup for testing company (find it from GHL: Careers Page > Website > Staging Funnel)
  • Logged into both GoHighLevel (GHL) and HireBus.
  • Select the appropriate company on GHL (e.g., Staging GHL Test Company).
    • Both systems (GHL and HireBus) should be configured to sync correctly.

Steps to reproduce

Step 1
Action

GHL: navigate to Applicants and create a new contact (no phone if simulating Indeed-like data). Enter First Name, Last Name, and unique Email (yourname+testcandidate@hirebus.com). Click Save.
Input data

First Name, Last Name, Email
Expected result

The contact is successfully created in GHL.
Step 2
Action

GHL: In the newly created GHL contact’s profile, go to Automation, select the 1. New Applicant (JOB ROLE) workflow, and add it.
Input data
Expected result

The automation is successfully applied, and the contact should now be tagged or categorized as a New Lead.
Step 3
Action

HB: Navigate to the Hiring Pipeline, and select the corresponding JobRole1 and observe the candidate
Input data
Expected result

Newly created candidate should appear under New Lead
Step 4
Action

On the Careers page (Typeform embedded), fill out the application form with the exact same email as used in step 1 (yourname+testcandidate@hirebus.com). Provide First Name, Last Name, Phone, upload Resume, and answer all required questions. Submit the form.
Input data

Candidate details, including the same Email
Expected result

The application is submitted successfully. Typeform and Zapier/GHL integrations trigger updates.
Step 5
Action

GHL: Observe that in messaging section there will be Opportunity updated and relevant automation should applied
Input data
Expected result

We should see first opportunity created while creating the contact, and now Opportunity updated should appear with accurate information
Step 6
Action

HB: Refresh the Hiring Pipeline for that job role.
Input data
Expected result

The same candidate’s stage should update from “New Lead” to “Application Completed,” reflecting the completed application via Typeform. No new/duplicate candidate is created; the existing record is updated.
Step 7
Action

HB: Open the candidate’s profile and check that the answers provided in the Typeform (e.g., resume, contact details) are retained successfully.
Input data
Expected result

Candidate’s details and responses are visible, confirming that the information persisted.
Step 8
Action

Check candidate’s email inbox (the address used: yourname+testcandidate@hirebus.com).
Input data
Expected result

Candidate receives an application completion email with the next-step instructions.
Step 9
Action

HB: Under candidate’s Individual Report > Messages section.
Input data
Expected result

The same email message received by the candidate is visible under the candidate’s messages.
Step 10
Action

GHL: Observe the same email message should be visible
Input data
Expected result

The application completion email/message is also visible in GHL’s messages section for the candidate.
HIREBUS-113 / Hirebus Testcases / HB-GHL Sync (Typeform way)

Verify the post–Application Completed flow (HireBus Assessment)

Verify that a candidate in the Application Completed stage receives the HireBus Assessment email, completes the assessment, and moves to the correct stage (HireBus Completed or Rejected) based on their score. Ensure email notifications are sent and visible under the candidate’s Messages tab. If the candidate is rejected, validate that they can still be manually moved through the pipeline by transitioning them to Manual Review, then to Schedule Phone Interview, and further interview stages as needed

Severity

Normal

Priority

Not set

Behavior

Not set

Type

Smoke

Layer

Not set

Is Flaky

No

Milestone

-

Automation

Manual

Status

Actual

Is Muted

No
Pre-conditions
  • Logged into both GoHighLevel (GHL) and HireBus.
  • Select the appropriate company on GHL (e.g., Staging GHL Test Company).
    • Both systems (GHL and HireBus) should be configured to sync correctly.
  • Candidate is already in Application Completed stage (e.g., from Typeform submission).
  • The candidate has a valid email address used for receiving assessment instructions, and you should have access to that
  • HireBus Assessment link/workflow is configured in the staging environment.

Steps to reproduce

Step 1
Action

Navigate to the candidate in the HireBus Staging Platform who is in the Application Completed stage. Go to their Messages tab
Input data

Candidate details from the previous flow
Expected result

The Messages tab should contains the emails/SMS and last email/SMS should contain the assessment link
Step 2
Action

Open the candidate’s Email Inbox. Look for an email titled “Thank You for Your Interest” or similar. Click the provided link to the HireBus Assessment
Input data
Expected result

Verify that the email is received successfully and contains the correct assessment
link (and that same link should be visible under Messages tab on HB as mentioned in previous step)
Step 3
Action

Complete the HireBus Assessment by entering at least 30 words (or per instructions). Submit the assessment. Wait for 1 minute and refresh the Hiring Pipeline in HireBus
Input data
Expected result
  • If score ≥ 7: Candidate moves to the HireBus Completed stage.
  • If score < 7: Candidate moves to the Rejected stage
Step 4
Action

If the candidate scored < 7, confirm they are in the Rejected stage. Check their email inbox for a rejection notice
Input data
Expected result

Verify that the rejection notice email is received successfully (if configured).
Step 5
Action

If the candidate scored > 7, confirm they are in the Accepted - Waiting List stage. Check their email inbox for a further notice
Input data
Expected result

Verify that the acceptance notice email is received successfully (if configured).
Step 6
Action

Manually move the applicant from Rejected to the Manual Review stage in the Hiring Pipeline.
Input data
Expected result

The applicant successfully moves to the Manual Review stage.
Step 7
Action

Verify the applicant’s status in the Hiring Pipeline after moving to Manual Review. Refresh the page to confirm.
Input data
Expected result

Applicant remains in the Manual Review stage, and no errors occur.
Step 8
Action

Move the applicant to Needs to Schedule Phone Interview stage in the Hiring Pipeline.
Input data
Expected result

Applicant successfully transitions to the Needs to Schedule Phone Interview stage.
Step 9
Action

Wait up to 1 minute for automation to trigger the automation and check the applicant’s Email Inbox for the Invitation to Schedule Interview email.
Input data
Expected result

Automation should send the Invitation to Schedule Interview email to candidate
HIREBUS-115 / Hirebus Testcases / HB-GHL Sync (Typeform way)

Verify multi-stage interview scheduling and final stages

Verify that a candidate progresses seamlessly through the interview scheduling workflow and final stages. This includes:

  1. Scheduling interviews (Phone, Video, and In-Person) while ensuring consistent contact details and email triggers.
  2. Confirming stage advancements (Needs to Schedule → Attend Interview stages).
  3. Moving the candidate through final stages: Reference Check, Accepted Hired (offer email sent), and Accepted Waiting (waiting list email sent).

Ensure all transitions, automations, and email notifications function correctly without errors.
